Package chess

Class Rook

java.lang.Object
chess.Piece
chess.Rook
public class Rook extends Piece
Represents a rook piece in the game of chess.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Vanessa Chin, Sean Maye

      public boolean moved
      Keeps track of whether or not a rook has made its first move

  • Constructor Details

    • Rook

      public Rook(int x, int y, boolean color)
      Creates the Rook object.

      This method calls its super class piece

      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate of the rook
      y - the y coordinate of the rook
      color - the color of the rook piece
      See Also:
      • Piece

  • Method Details

    • move

      public boolean move(int dX, int dY)
      Returns true if the move made by the rook is legal. The dX and dY arguments must be integers

      This method is overridden from its super class, piece

      Specified by:
      move in class Piece
      Parameters:
      dX - the x coordinate of where the rook would like to move
      dY - the y coordinate of where the rook would like to move
      Returns:
      true if the move is legal and false if the move is illegal
      See Also:
      • Piece

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns string that will represent the piece on the board
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      wR if the piece is white and bR if the piece is black
